image.altText: Snowy landscape with cabins in background.

props.synopsis: Thousands of Tasmanian homes are without power, and tomorrow's Salamanca Market is cancelled as wild weather continues — and the Bureau of Meteorology says the worst is yet to come.

title.children: Tasmania not 'out of the woods yet' as BOM warns windiest weather still to come

image.altText: someone vaping

props.synopsis: The federal government has failed "to protect our children and young people", Tasmania's health minister says, as he unveils new vaping restrictions.

title.children: Vapes will become easier to purchase again in October. But Tasmania is trying to reverse this

image.altText: Exterior of the Supreme Court building in Hobart.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian 40-year-old John Oldfield Nettleton has been jailed for committing dozens of "abhorrent" sexual abuse offences against children overseas over a two-year period.

title.children: Tasmanian man jailed for dozens of child sexual abuse crimes overseas

image.altText: Truck travels down regional road.

props.synopsis: A drunk driver jailed after a fatal crash in Queensland that killed a much-loved Tasmanian father of three has said he wished he had died in his place.

title.children: Drunk driver jailed for more than six years over crash that killed 'exceptional' Tasmanian father

image.altText: A man in glasses, China's ambassador to the Pacific nations Qian Bo, wearing a blue shirt.

props.synopsis: China's ambassador to the Pacific has responded furiously after the region's leaders rejected a push from Solomon Islands to stop Taiwan participating in its top diplomatic gathering.

title.children: China responds furiously after Pacific leaders reject bid to cut ties with Taiwan

image.altText: A woman with blonde hair holding her 7 week old baby.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian mother Erin McGinn says there weren't enough midwives at the Royal Hobart Hospital to help her when she needed it after giving birth to her daughter, Amelia. Then later was forced to change to formula feeding.

title.children: 'I could have killed someone last night': Midwife says Royal Hobart Hospital maternity ward severely understaffed

image.altText: A man wearing a light blue liberal shirt stands at the front of a group of people who are all tossing their caps in the air.

props.synopsis: Premier Jeremy Rockliff has made unity a priority in a party plagued by discord, but this Saturday's state council meeting will tell how well that central tenet is being adhered to.

title.children: Just how united is the Tasmanian Liberal Party? We'll find out this weekend

image.altText: A closeup image of a hands on a steering wheel from outside the car at night with red lights streaming passed.

props.synopsis: When rideshare driver Mo picked up passengers last month, he didn't expect to be held at knifepoint. Advocates say it's an all too common occurrence — and are calling for better protections for gig economy workers.

title.children: Importance of gig economy protections highlighted, after Tasmanian ride share driver held at knifepoint

image.altText: A small blue boat pressed up against a wooden boardwalk, with signs of damage

props.synopsis: Fears the iconic "little blue boat" in Hobart's northern suburbs could be gone forever have been quelled, for now, thanks to the help of a passionate community who rushed to help save it.

title.children: The 'little blue boat' that could: Iconic vessel likely to be restored after storm damage

image.altText: A group of young Palestinian men stand in a street next to the burnt-out wreckage of a car.

props.synopsis: Hostilities have escalated in the West Bank while fighting between the IDF and Hamas still rages in the Gaza Strip, nearly 11 months after Israel invaded the territory.

title.children: Israeli police kill top Hamas commander near Jenin as West Bank assault enters third day

image.altText: Three children playing on a beach with storm clouds in the distance.

props.synopsis: The death toll from recent monsoon rain also rose, with children among the dead after a house was destroyed in a mudslide in rural Pakistan.

title.children: Warnings of rare August cyclone in Pakistan and India lead thousands to evacuate

image.altText: A police car blocks off the entrance to a government facility

props.synopsis: An Indigenous teenager who died after self-harming at Banksia Hill had only been in the facility for two days, according to authorities. Here's what else we know about the latest tragedy in WA youth detention.

title.children: What we know so far about the death of another teenager inside WA's troubled youth justice system

image.altText: Rory Amon

props.synopsis: Rory Amon is accused of five counts of sexual intercourse with a person between 10 and 14 and two counts of attempting sexual intercourse with a person between 10 and 14.

title.children: 'I deny all charges': Sydney MP makes statement after being charged with child sex offences

image.altText: Keira Stephens of Australia dives into the pool for a race at the Paralympics

props.synopsis: Australia has added two golds and a silver to its medal tally in Paris on day two, with the para swimmers looking to continue in the pool. Follow live.

title.children: Para swimmers race for medals after golden day at the velodrome for Australia

image.altText: the outside of a building

props.synopsis: Once perceived as the glittering symbol of city sophistication, Australia's biggest listed casino group has found itself reduced to the status of last chance saloon.

title.children: Fallen Star: Why Australia's gaming giant is hanging by a thread

image.altText: A woman with dark hair smiles with a man behind her

props.synopsis: The stakes for Kamala Harris and Tim Walz were high as they sat down with CNN for their first interview since Joe Biden stepped aside. These were the biggest moments.

title.children: It's no secret Kamala Harris hates interviews. These were the big moments from her sit-down with CNN

image.altText: seven-network-journalist-robert-ovadia delivers the news as he looks at the camera

props.synopsis: Lawyers for Robert Ovadia have argued that the behaviour, which included sending a photo of a flaccid penis from the internet, was not sexual harassment and that his dismissal was unlawful.

title.children: Sacked Seven journalist dismisses complaints, denies behaviour was sexual harassment

image.altText: A phone inside a mug that says 'have a nice day'.

props.synopsis: On December 12, 2022, three innocent people were ambushed by extremists and murdered in cold blood in a country Queensland town. Why it occurred may never be fully understood.

title.children: It started as a routine police call. By the end of the night, six people were dead

image.altText: Two fighter jets flying together.

props.synopsis: The Ukrainian military has paid tribute to pilot Oleksii "Moonfish" Mes, saying he "heroically fought his last battle in the skies".

title.children: Top Ukrainian fighter pilot killed after NATO-donated F-16 jet crashes repelling Russian missiles

image.altText: AFL umpire in high vis t-shirt on an AFL ground.

props.synopsis: The AFL has slapped a life ban on a 23-year-old Carlton fan, after he allegedly threw a water bottle that struck and injured a goal umpire.

title.children: AFL bans footy fan for life for throwing water bottle at a goal umpire

image.altText: Covid germs hover over a graph on a black background

props.synopsis: A Senate inquiry looking into why more Australians have died in the past four years than expected has found COVID-19 continues to have a crushing impact on local health systems.

title.children: Senate report recommends compensation scheme for people injured by vaccines

image.altText: Hail in the Bendigo suburb of Ascot

props.synopsis: Winter has performed a dramatic final act across the country, delivering a week of wild weather that has included heat records, damaging winds, thunderstorms, and cold snaps all at once.

title.children: Heat records, cold snaps and fierce winds. Winter says farewell with dramatic final week

image.altText: Anthony Albanese wears a stern expression on his face as he sits in the House of Reps

props.synopsis: The prime minister overturns a decision earlier this week to omit a new question on sexuality being added to the national census, after several Labor MPs spoke out against the move.

title.children: Albanese backs down on decision to exclude LGBT question from next census

image.altText: Opera Australia artistic director Jo Davies sits in an audience seat in an empty theatre.

props.synopsis: Jo Davies, artistic director of Opera Australia, has left the company over a 'difference in opinion' with the CEO and board about how to balance artistic and commercial imperatives.

title.children: 'I am incredibly sad': Opera Australia's first woman artistic director leaves role after nine months

image.altText: Damaged ship with mast down at port with a shipping container in the background

props.synopsis: Two people are injured following a collision between a large container ship and a training vessel at a Perth port.

title.children: Two people injured as container ship collides with training vessel at Perth port

image.altText: A woman with short black hair wearing a black and white shirt looks seriously at the camera. She is inside.

props.synopsis: Pressure is building for the board members of Australia's largest Indigenous legal aid service to step down, after revelations the federal and NT attorney-general departments have lost confidence in their ability to manage the organisation.

title.children: NAAJA co-founder calls for entire board's resignation amid internal turmoil

image.altText: A baby in hospital with burns.

props.synopsis: A baby boy burned after coffee was poured on him in a random attack at a Brisbane park will have surgery on Friday to help determine the extent of his injuries.

title.children: Baby boy burned in hot coffee attack to undergo surgery as search for suspect continues

image.altText: A group of listeria bacteria in blue.

props.synopsis: Nine people have died and 50 people have been hospitalised as part of a listeria outbreak in the United States.

title.children: Listeria outbreak linked to nine deaths in US

image.altText: A cream station homestead with a palm tree and large garden with green lawns.

props.synopsis: In a landmark deal Australian Food and Agriculture Company plans to sell sheep, cattle, and cropping properties that span 225,000 hectares across NSW and include the historic Boonoke and Wanganella stations.

title.children: Iconic farms spanning 225,000ha to be snapped up by US investors in $780m deal

image.altText: Someone waves a rainbow coloured flag in the sunlight above a crowd of people

props.synopsis: A single question about sexuality doesn't encompass the LGBTQI+ community's complexity and diverse needs, experts and advocates say.

title.children: What does including LGBTQI+ people in the census look like, and what could be missing?

image.altText: Dinush Kurera walks out of a prison van, wearing a black jacket.

props.synopsis: A Melbourne man who killed his wife with a knife and an axe has been found guilty of murder, with a Supreme Court jury rejecting his story that he was acting in self-defence.

title.children: Melbourne man found guilty of murdering wife with knife and axe, and assaulting teenage son

image.altText: David Holmes, looking unhappy, leans on the back of a chair

props.synopsis: After a couple of years working at Southern Cross Station, elevator mechanic David Holmes says he struggled to exercise, was constantly tired and realised his skin was turning yellow.

title.children: Former worker from major Melbourne train station lodges compensation claim over diesel fumes

props.synopsis: Residents are allowed to return after evacuating from near a head-on crash and explosion on the Bruce Highway in central Queensland, the third major truck crash on the central Queensland highway this week.

title.children: Explosion felt kilometres away as truck carrying 42 tonnes of ammonium nitrate crashes on Bruce Highway

image.altText: Singer Robbie Williams dressed in all one colour raises his arms in the air as he performs at the AFL Grand Final at the MCG.

props.synopsis: The Victorian Supreme Court found grand prix organisers misled a music touring company about messages received from then-chief health officer Brett Sutton during the pandemic.

title.children: Robbie Williams promoters set to receive millions over grand prix cancellation on the eve of lockdowns

image.altText: Graphic of secure mental health rehabilitation sign

props.synopsis: Deaths by suicide inside mental health units are nationally reportable sentinel events, defined as "adverse patient safety events that are wholly preventable".

title.children: Probe into hospital suicide deaths finds major Brisbane mental health unit no longer fit for purpose
